title: Bayesian Linear Regression
contentHtml:
In Bayesian linear regression, we model the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables using a probabilistic approach.

The prior distribution of the coefficients is crucial in this framework.
name: Posterior distribution of coefficients" },
problemHtml: Suppose we have a dataset of exam scores and corresponding hours studied. We want to predict the score based on the number of hours studied.

title: Bayesian Linear Regression: Prior on Coefficients
contentHtml: In Bayesian linear regression, we place a prior distribution on the coefficients to incorporate our prior knowledge about the relationships between features and the target variable.
name: Prior on Coefficients" },
problemHtml: Suppose we have a dataset of students' grades and hours studied. We want to predict the grade based on the number of hours studied.

finalAnswer: The prior distribution on the coefficients" },

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Linear Regression: Prior on Coefficients
contentHtml:
In Bayesian linear regression, we model the relationship between a response variable and one or more predictor variables using a probabilistic approach.

The prior distribution on the coefficients represents our initial beliefs about the relationships between the predictors and the response.
